channel.title: Compiler help. Simple question
channel.description:
Ok so im trying to compile my rsps, but it wont work for some reason. Here is the code in using. [code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/... :end echo Finished! pause exit[/code]
This is what happens: [IMG]http://i25.tinypic.com/dy9gr8.jpg[/img]
Help??

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

How do you know that it didn’t compile, and what error is it giving you due to missing .cfg’s?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Deecee Deecee
item.description:
@Deecee wrote:

That means the files have been compiled, if you have your .class files in a different folder then that is why your server is updating.
[/quote]

You either have really bad grammar, or don’t speak English well. So i moved all of my .class files and .java files together, compiled and it worked. Now it says i’m missed some .cfg files. So i added the .cfg files and it says there still missing…

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Deecee, post:17, topic:348553”][quote author=jmood128 link=topic=444932.msg3267424#msg3267424 date=1278964485]

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp *.java pause

try that.

The compiler your using doesn’t have the *.java giving you that error you need to have * in front of the .java or your compiler won’t work.
[/quote]

Did but it just says one thing, “Press any key to continue. . .” Then when i run my server and go into it it has not compiled.[/quote]

That means the files have been compiled, if you have your .class files in a different folder then that is why your server is updating.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Deecee Deecee
item.description:
@Deecee wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:16, topic:348553”] @echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp *.java pause

try that.

The compiler your using doesn’t have the *.java giving you that error you need to have * in front of the .java or your compiler won’t work.[/quote]

Did but it just says one thing, “Press any key to continue. . .” Then when i run my server and go into it it has not compiled.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp *.java pause

try that.

The compiler your using doesn’t have the *.java giving you that error you need to have * in front of the .java or your compiler won’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Deecee Deecee
item.description:
@Deecee wrote:

the compiler is saying no source files, you need to have the compiler with your .java files. If you read what the compiler says then you would know what your problem is.

…

a4o1eq.jpg793×562

EDIT: Ok so i edited the compiler again, and the only thing that pops up it, “Press any key to continue. . .”

I Ran the server and went in and it didn’t compile at all.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“Deecee, post:11, topic:348553”][quote author=a-person link=topic=444932.msg3267335#msg3267335 date=1278960548]
Have you set the class paths?
[/quote]
Yes. I Have set CLASSPATH in user variables, and PATH in system variables.

is your java in
program files (x86)

???/
???
???//

Do you mean is my java directory found in program files? Yes.

EDIT: Ok so i changed this:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

To this:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp .java pause

And i got this:
[/quote]

the compiler is saying no source files, you need to have the compiler with your .java files. If you read what the compiler says then you would know what your problem is.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Deecee Deecee
item.description:
@Deecee wrote:

jmood128:

if your running 64 a 64 bit OS then you have to use the Jdk in your (x86) directory, just add a space and (x86) next to program files.

I have a 32 bit

EDIT: Ok so i changed this:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause

To this:

@echo off title Compile "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" -cp .java pause

And i got this:

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler help. Simple question
item.dc:creator: @Deecee Deecee
item.description:
@Deecee wrote:

mark033:

I’m pretty sure that that is telling you that there are no .java files for the compiler to compile. Is it in the right folder?

Yes. and i use the same compiler for my client and it works just fine.

[quote=“matiasmunk, post:3, topic:348553”]Download Java Jdk
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/widget/jdk6.jsp[/quote]
I Do have java Jdk
